p: The antioxidant mechanism is important in the ability to strengthen the defensive factors of the gastric mucosa. The antioxidant mechanism of action of flavonoids includes: (1) free radical scavenging; (2) chelating metal; (3) inhibition of enzymes associated with the generation of free radicals; (4) stimulation of endogenous antioxidant mechanisms [ 172, 173]. Studies showed that flavonoids rutin [ 63], diosmin [ 92], chrysin [ 89], isoorientin [ 98], and naringenin [ 107] increase the activities of antioxidant enzymes CAT, SOD, and GPx, protecting the gastric mucosa against oxidative stress.
